definition[0]: a main RAW MATERIAL (=a material such as coal or oil in its natural state before being treated in order to make things) used for making products such as plastics and NYLON
example[0]: Coal tar was the feedstock for all kinds of chemicals until it was replaced by oil.
definition[1]: food such as grain given to animals on farms
example[1]: Its activities included supplying feedstock and seeds, managing the sale of produce and supplying agricultural machinery.
